skill.name: PDF Processing
skill.description: Extract text and tables from PDF files, fill forms, merge documents. Use when working with PDF files or when the user mentions PDFs, forms, or document extraction.
skill.summary: Extract text and tables from PDF files, fill forms, merge documents. Use when working with PDF files...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing PDF processing examples. No executable code, network calls, or sensitive operations. All code samples use standard Python libraries (pdfplumber, pypdf) for their stated purpose of PDF manipulation.

content.value_statement: Manual PDF data extraction is tedious and error-prone. This skill provides code patterns for extracting text, tables, and form data from PDFs using Python libraries.
actual_capabilities: Extract text from PDF documents page by page
Detect and extract tables from PDF files
Fill PDF forms with programmatic data
Merge multiple PDF files into one document
Split PDFs to extract specific page ranges
Convert PDFs to images using pdf2image
limitations: Does not perform OCR on scanned documents (requires pytesseract setup)
Cannot edit existing PDF content, only append new pages
Requires external dependencies (poppler for image conversion)

use_cases.title: Extract Table Data
use_cases.description: Pull tabular data from PDF reports into CSV or spreadsheet formats for analysis.

use_cases.title: Automate Form Filling
use_cases.description: Fill PDF forms with data from databases or spreadsheets programmatically.

use_cases.title: Build PDF Workflows
use_cases.description: Create pipelines to merge, split, and process PDF documents in applications.

prompt_templates.title: Extract Text
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all text from the PDF document located at [file_path] and save it to [output_file].

prompt_templates.title: Extract Tables
prompt_templates.prompt: Find and extract all tables from [pdf_file] and save them as a CSV file.

prompt_templates.title: Fill Form
prompt_templates.prompt: Fill the PDF form at [form_path] with these values: [field_values]. Save as [output_path].

prompt_templates.title: Merge PDFs
prompt_templates.prompt: Merge these PDF files [file_list] into a single document called [output_name].

best_practices: Validate PDF files before processing to avoid errors on corrupted documents
Work on copies of original files to prevent accidental data loss
Handle exceptions gracefully for pages with no extractable text
anti_patterns: Processing entire PDFs when only specific pages are needed
Skipping error handling for large or complex PDF files
Filling forms without first analyzing the form field structure

faq.question: Which PDF libraries does this skill support?
faq.answer: pdfplumber for text/table extraction, pypdf for manipulation, pdf2image for conversion, pytesseract for OCR.

faq.question: What are the size limits for PDF processing?
faq.answer: Processing is limited by available system memory. Very large files may require chunked processing.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: Yes. Use Python scripts in Claude, Codex, or Claude Code to chain PDF processing with other workflows.

faq.question: Is my data safe during processing?
faq.answer: Yes. All processing happens locally. No data is sent to external servers. Files are read only when you specify paths.

faq.question: Why does my scanned PDF show no text?
faq.answer: Scanned PDFs contain images, not selectable text. Use pytesseract with OCR enabled to extract text from scans.

faq.question: How is this different from online PDF tools?
faq.answer: This skill runs locally in your Python environment. No file uploads, no privacy concerns, works offline.
